pages.text: Translate This Page Afrikaans Albanian Arabic Armenian Azerbaijani Basque Belarusian Bengali Bosnian Bulgarian Catalan Cebuano Chinese (Simplified) Chinese (Traditional) Croatian Czech Danish Dutch English Esperanto Estonian Filipino Finnish French Galician Georgian German Greek Gujarati Haitian Creole Hausa Hebrew Hindi Hmong Hungarian Icelandic Igbo Indonesian Irish Italian Japanese Javanese Kannada Khmer Korean Lao Latin Latvian Lithuanian Macedonian Malay Maltese Maori Marathi Mongolian Nepali Norwegian Persian Polish Portuguese Punjabi Romanian Russian Serbian Slovak Slovenian Somali Spanish Swahili Swedish Tamil Telugu Thai Turkish Ukrainian Urdu Vietnamese Welsh Yiddish Yoruba Zulu /#translation-links /#social-media-links Search /#search /#controls /.tiny-slider Home Government 2024 City Council Election /#breadcrumbs Related Pages 2024 Candidates Gabriel Johnson Steve Osmer Nicolle Boujaber Mike Chase Jazzie Hennings Stephen Sams Candidate Qualifying Information /#flyout-wrap /.col-md-3 November 5, 2024 City Council Election City Election Results: Mayor Osmer, Councilmember Mike Chase and Councilmember Stephen Sams will be sworn in at the Regular Council meeting of November 20, 2024. What will be on the Ballot? The Mayor and two (2) City Council seats Candidates For a list of candidates, please click here . Important Dates August 2 - August 16, 2024:  Candidate Qualifying Period October 7, 2024:  Last day to register to vote in November election October 21, 2024 - November 2, 2024:  Early voting period. Polling Locations Click on the links below to view the precinct maps: Precinct 405 : Scotty Culp Municipal Complex, 565 Cassia Blvd SAMPLE BALLOT Precinct 415 :  David R. Schechter Community Center, 1089 South Patrick Dr. SAMPLE BALLOT Precinct 437 :  David R. Schechter Community Center, 1089 South Patrick Dr. SAMPLE BALLOT Voter Registration Information Brevard County Supervisor of Elections Office: (321) 633-2124 or www.votebrevard.gov To register to vote online, visit https://registertovoteflorida.gov/home Candidate Information Candidates must be registered voters in the City of Satellite Beach and have resided in Satellite Beach for one (1) year prior to qualifying date. Term of office is four (4) years. This year, there are the Mayor and two (2) Council seats to be filled. Candidates shall be ranked according to total votes received from high to low, with those ranked highest to be declared elected in order to fill the number of vacant positions and expiring terms. Candidate Qualifying Period and Election Qualifying Forms The Candidate Qualifying Period is August 2 - August 16, 2024 .  The following items must be submitted to the City Clerk during the qualifying period: City Nominating Petition that must be signed by 10 registered voters in the City of Satellite Beach ( must be notarized) DS-DE9 Appointment of Campaign Treasurer and Designation of Campaign Depository for Candidates Form DS-DE 302NP, Candidate Oath ( must be notarized) Form 1, Statement of Financial Interests ( must be filed electronically in the Florida Commission on Ethics Electronic Financial Disclosure Management System) Check from campaign checking account made payable to the City of Satellite Beach Mayor candidate:  $13.00 ($12.00 State Qualifying Fee; $1.00 City Qualifying Fee) Council candidate: $7.00 ($6.00 State Qualifying Fee; $1.00 City Qualifying Fee) Please contact Gwen Peirce, City Clerk, at [email protected] or (321) 773-4407 for information on running for Council. /#post /#entry /.col-md-6 /.row /.container November 5, 2024 City Council Election City Election Results: Mayor Osmer, Councilmember Mike Chase and Councilmember Stephen Sams will be sworn in at the Regular Council meeting of November 20, 2024. What will be on the Ballot? The Mayor and two (2) City Council seats Candidates For a list of candidates, please click here . Important Dates August 2 - August 16, 2024:  Candidate Qualifying Period October 7, 2024:  Last day to register to vote in November election October 21, 2024 - November 2, 2024:  Early voting period. Term of office is four (4) years. This year, there are the Mayor and two (2) Council seats to be filled. Candidates shall be ranked according to total votes received from high to low, with those ranked highest to be declared elected in order to fill the number of vacant positions and expiring terms.
